result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs) and Cause Injury-Operating w/ PAC-Passenger. The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs) and the other charge, Cause Injury-Operating w/ PAC-Passenger was dismissed by the court.

  • Razelle T Creed was found guilty of Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with victim.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.  Not to possess any alcohol in residence.

If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment.

AMENDED 04/01/2015 - HUBER IS GRANTED FOR PARENTING COURSES, AODA ASSESSMENT, AND FOLLOW-UP COUNSELING AS WELL AS INDIVIDUAL THERAPY PURSUANT TO THE DISPOSITIONAL ORDER IN THE JC CASES AS MONITORED AND IMPLEMENTED BY RACINE COUNTY HUMAN SERVICES AGENT. THE JAIL SHALL VERIFY ALL COURSES AND RELEASE.
Consecutive to: to 14CF313

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Razelle T Creed in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Razelle T Creed in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 08-31-2015/tk
Defense requests modification of jail terms. Defense is asking that defendant be allowed to participate in AODA program in custody, which commences on June 1. The State agrees AODA counseling is appropriate but the State believes the out of custody portion of the AODA program would be contrary to the intent of the Court due to the punishment received by the victim. The State has no problem with huber to include AODA therapy and counseling but does not feel the AODA program is appropriate at this time.

BTC: Defendant has not yet served enough time to avail himself to the AODA program. The Court will allow that after a period of 12 months, the defendant may engage in the AODA jail program. The defendant may have Huber to obtain his GED. Defense to prepare an order regarding the Court's decision today.

Preliminary hearing on April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim A.W. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. Has until 04-03-2014 to get this done.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 01/30/15    ADDITIONAL CONDITION OF NO DRIVING WITHOUT VALID LICENSE.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN EFFECT.
